title: WireEDM Skim Speed + Johnson-Cook Strain Rate Ref + Surface Finish Operation Param
scope: Fix M-007 (WireEDM skim inverted), M-008 (J-C strain_rate_ref hardcoded), M-010 (surface_finish missing operation)

findings.title: WireEDM skim speed formula produces speeds ABOVE rough cut (2.0-i*0.3 = 2.0x, 1.7x multipliers)
findings.fix: Changed multiplier from (2.0 - i*0.3) to Math.max(0.2, 0.8 - i*0.15) — skim speeds now 80%/65%/50%/35% of rough cut
changes: Line 90: firstCutSpeed * (2.0 - i*0.3) → firstCutSpeed * Math.max(0.2, 0.8 - i*0.15)
Added comment: M-007 fix: was (2.0 - i*0.3) giving speeds ABOVE rough cut — inverted

findings.title: Johnson-Cook strain_rate_ref hardcoded to 1.0 s⁻¹ but material DB uses 0.001 s⁻¹
findings.fix: Added strain_rate_ref? optional field to JohnsonCookParams interface, use params.strain_rate_ref ?? 1.0 as default

findings.title: calcDispatcher surface_finish action does not pass operation param to calculateSurfaceFinish()
findings.fix: Added params.operation as argument to calculateSurfaceFinish() call in calcDispatcher.ts
changes: surface_finish case: added params.operation to calculateSurfaceFinish() call

spot_checks.test: WireEDM skim speeds below rough cut
spot_checks.expected: Each successive skim pass slower: 80%, 65%, 50%, 35% of first cut

notes: All three fixes are straightforward corrections with no architectural risk. J-C strain_rate_ref backward-compatible (defaults to previous value 1.0).
